description: Ragda pattice is a popular Indian street food dish of spiced potato patties with delicious and hearty curry sauce. Quick soaked chickpeas work perfectly in this recipe.
name: Chickpea Ragda Patties Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chickpeas in a large pan, cover with water and bring to the boil. Boil for 1 minute, remove from the heat and soak for 1 hour. Drain and place back in the pan. Add the turmeric and a pinch of asafoetida and cover with water. Bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes. Drain and set aside.

Heat a tablespoon of oil in a large pan on medium high heat and cook the ginger and garlic paste for 12 minutes. Add the chilli powder, a teaspoon of garam masala and a pinch of asafoetida and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tamarind paste and chickpeas, add 500ml of water and simmer for 8-10 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in 2 tablespoons of fresh coriander and set aside to thicken.

For the patties, place the potatoes in a large pan of boiling water and cook for 810 minutes, until softened and drain well. Tip into a bowl with the rest of the coriander, garam masala, green chilli and breadcrumbs and mix well. Shape into patties with your hands.

Heat the rest of the oil in a large pan on medium high heat and cook the patties for 23 minutes on each side, pressing down as they cook, until they are golden and crisp. To serve, divide the patties between 4 plates and pour the curry sauce on top.
